ygData.messageBody:
Great suggestion-- i don't dual much, but i think
you can get melee skills up well that way. Either
that, or get in a group that doesn't need much healing
and bash away as much as possible-- your hits won't
agro much, so your offense and weapon skills are the
only ones like to go up this way--unless you can agro
with spells.<br><br>Suggestion-- before you try these
things, layer up on all DEX and AGI items/buffs you can
find. This will help your offense/defense/weapon skills
go up quicker. <br><br>Can't train in
offense/defense-- : (<br><br>Bottom Line, though--- how much melee
do you really think you'll be doing?? Defense will
go up if you keep healing and agroing things on you.
I fought the good fight as a druid and still would
melee up to about lvl 29. I still melee when soloing
SOMETIMES-- more often though i'll do classic root kiting and
never pick up a weapon, i'd rather hold somthing that
gives me more WIS or Mana. <br><br>Would you be screwed
if you didn't up your melee skills at all?? Not
really. Would you be screwed if you didn't up your
Alteration at every level-- DEFINITELY!!<br><br>Xela
Orcbane<br>Druid of the 33d Season<br>Priest of Tunare, who has
given up physical combat<br>Xev
